description: From Latin ātra bīlis (“black bile”) (āter (“dark, black”) + bīlis (“bile”))  +‎ -ous (“full of”).

adjectives.description: atrabilious (comparative more atrabilious, superlative most atrabilious)

entries.meaning: (medicine, obsolete) Having an excess of black bile.
examples: [I] could see nothing in the evidence which did persuade me to think them other than poor, melancholy, envious, mischievous, ill-disposed, ill-dieted, atrabilious constitutions.
